About Me

Currently an ATER at Sorbonne UniversitÃ©, I defended my PhD in December 2024. My research focuses on SAT solving and symmetry exploitation. I have experience in teaching programming (C, Python, Java) and data structures.

Research

My PhD research explored symmetry-based optimizations for SAT solving, developing the CosySEL solver. I also worked on integrating genetic algorithms and AI techniques for CDCL solversâ€™ initialization.
